org.codefx.libfx.listener.handle

Interface ListenerHandle

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ListenerAttachHandle, ListenerDetachHandle
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ControlPropertyListenerHandle, NestedListenerHandle, WebViewHyperlinkListenerHandle
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NestedChangeListenerHandle, NestedInvalidationListenerHandle

    public interface ListenerHandle
extends ListenerAttachHandle, ListenerDetachHandle
    A listener handle can be used to attach and detach a listener to/from some observable instance.

    Using the handler the calling code does not have to manage references to both the observed instance and the listener, which can improve readability.

    A handle is created and returned by methods which connect a listener with an observable instance. This usually means that the listener is actually added to the observable but it is also possible to simply return a handler and wait for the call to attach() before adding the listener. It is up to such methods to specify this behavior.

    Unless otherwise noted it is not safe to share a handle between different threads. The behavior is undefined if parallel calls are made to attach() and/or detach().

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface org.codefx.libfx.listener.handle.ListenerAttachHandle

        attach

      • Methods inherited from interface org.codefx.libfx.listener.handle.ListenerDetachHandle

        detach
